intro: Dyschoriste somalensis, commonly known as the Somali dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native region.
